New Records: Aaron Civale pitched his longest outing of the season with 7 innings.
Aaron Civale owns a 1.45 ERA in five starts at American Family Field since the Brewers acquired him in a July 3 trade.
Key Match Events: Aaron Civale and Aaron Ashby combined on a two-hit shutout.
William Contreras stole home to help the Milwaukee Brewers beat the San Francisco Giants 6-0.
Garrett Mitchell homered for the Brewers, and Jackson Chourio drove in two runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers Manager Pat Murphy emphasized that the team has enough to compete.
Giants Manager Bob Melvin said the Brewers' pitcher had a good cutter, a good sinker, and threw just enough off-speed to keep them off balance.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers Manager Pat Murphy expressed his team's ability to keep posting and competing.
Giants Manager Bob Melvin acknowledged that their team looked awful all around.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers are 9 1/2 games ahead of the Chicago Cubs for the biggest division lead in the majors.
The Giants went 2-4 on a six-game trip to fall below.500.
